entry.name: datepicker
entry.title: Datepicker Widget
entry.desc: Select a date from a popup or inline calendar

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Datepicker is a highly configurable plugin that adds datepicker functionality to your pages. You can customize the date format and language, restrict the selectable date ranges and add in buttons and other navigation options easily.
By default, the datepicker calendar opens in a small overlay when the associated text field gains focus. For an inline calendar, simply attach the datepicker to a div or span.
While the datepicker is open, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: PAGE UP: Move to the previous month.
PAGE DOWN: Move to the next month.
CTRL+PAGE UP: Move to the previous year.
CTRL+PAGE DOWN: Move to the next year.
CTRL+HOME: Move to the current month. Open the datepicker if closed.
CTRL+LEFT: Move to the previous day.
CTRL+RIGHT: Move to the next day.
CTRL+UP: Move to the previous week.
CTRL+END: Close the datepicker and erase the date.
ESCAPE: Close the datepicker without selection.
$.datepicker.setDefaults( settings ) - Set settings for all datepicker instances.
$.datepicker.formatDate( format, date, settings ) - Format a date into a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.parseDate( format, value, settings ) - Extract a date from a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.iso8601Week( date ) - Determine the week of the year for a given date: 1 to 53.
$.datepicker.noWeekends - Set as beforeShowDay function to prevent selection of weekends.

longdesc.p: Datepicker provides support for localizing its content to cater for different languages and date formats. Each localization is contained within its own file with the language code appended to the name, e.g., jquery.ui.datepicker-fr.js for French. The desired localization file should be included after the main datepicker code. Each localization file adds its settings to the set of available localizations and automatically applies them as defaults for all instances.

The $.datepicker.regional attribute holds an array of localizations, indexed by language code, with "" referring to the default (English). Each entry is an object with the following attributes: closeText, prevText, nextText, currentText, monthNames, monthNamesShort, dayNames, dayNamesShort, dayNamesMin, weekHeader, dateFormat, firstDay, isRTL, showMonthAfterYear, and yearSuffix.

option.name: altField
option.desc: An input element that is to be updated with the selected date from the datepicker. Use the altFormat option to change the format of the date within this field. Leave as blank for no alternate field.

option.name: altFormat
option.desc: The dateFormat to be used for the altField option. This allows one date format to be shown to the user for selection purposes, while a different format is actually sent behind the scenes. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function

option.name: appendText
option.desc: The text to display after each date field, e.g., to show the required format.

option.name: autoSize
option.desc: Set to true to automatically resize the input field to accommodate dates in the current dateFormat.

option.name: buttonImage
option.desc: The URL for the popup button image. If set, the buttonText option becomes the alt value and is not directly displayed.

option.name: buttonImageOnly
option.desc: Whether the button image should be rendered by itself instead of inside a button element.

option.name: buttonText
option.desc: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with the showOn option set to "button" or "both".

option.name: calculateWeek
option.desc: A function to calculate the week of the year for a given date. The default implementation uses the ISO 8601 definition: weeks start on a Monday; the first week of the year contains the first Thursday of the year.

option.name: changeMonth
option.desc: Whether the month should be rendered as a dropdown instead of text.

option.name: changeYear
option.desc: Whether the year should be rendered as a dropdown instead of text. Use the yearRange option to control which years are made available for selection.

option.name: closeText
option.desc: The text to display for the close link. Use the showButtonPanel option to display this button.

option.name: constrainInput
option.desc: When true, entry in the input field is constrained to those characters allowed by the current dateFormat option.

option.name: currentText
option.desc: The text to display for the current day link. Use the showButtonPanel option to display this button.

option.name: dateFormat
option.desc: The format for parsed and displayed dates. For a full list of the possible formats see the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function.

option.name: dayNames
option.desc: The list of long day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the dateFormat option.

option.name: dayNamesMin
option.desc: The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker.

option.name: dayNamesShort
option.desc: The list of abbreviated day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the dateFormat option.

option.name: defaultDate
option.desc: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank. Specify either an actual date via a Date object or as a string in the current [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]], or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +7d'), or null for today.

type.name: Date
type.desc: A date object containing the default date.

type.name: Number
type.desc: A number of days from today. For example 2 represents two days from today and -1 represents yesterday.

type.name: String
type.desc: A string in the format defined by the dateFormat option, or a relative date. Relative dates must contain value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

option.name: duration
option.desc: Control the speed at which the datepicker appears, it may be a time in milliseconds or a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast").

option.name: firstDay
option.desc: Set the first day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, etc.

option.name: gotoCurrent
option.desc: When true, the current day link moves to the currently selected date instead of today.

option.name: hideIfNoPrevNext
option.desc: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable (see the minDate and maxDate options). You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true.

option.name: isRTL
option.desc: Whether the current language is drawn from right to left.

option.name: maxDate
option.desc: The maximum selectable date. When set to null, there is no maximum.

type.name: Date
type.desc: A date object containing the maximum date.

type.name: Number
type.desc: A number of days from today. For example 2 represents two days from today and -1 represents yesterday.

type.name: String
type.desc: A string in the format defined by the dateFormat option, or a relative date. Relative dates must contain value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

option.name: minDate
option.desc: The minimum selectable date. When set to null, there is no minimum.

type.name: Date
type.desc: A date object containing the minimum date.

type.name: Number
type.desc: A number of days from today. For example 2 represents two days from today and -1 represents yesterday.

type.name: String
type.desc: A string in the format defined by the dateFormat option, or a relative date. Relative dates must contain value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

option.name: monthNames
option.desc: The list of full month names, for use as requested via the dateFormat option.

option.name: monthNamesShort
option.desc: The list of abbreviated month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the dateFormat option.

option.name: navigationAsDateFormat
option.desc: Whether the prevText and nextText options should be parsed as dates by the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function, allowing them to display the target month names for example.

option.name: nextText
option.desc: The text to display for the next month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

option.name: numberOfMonths
option.desc: The number of months to show at once.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The number of months to display in a single row.

type.name: Array
type.desc: An array defining the number of rows and columns to display.

option.name: prevText
option.desc: The text to display for the previous month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

option.name: selectOtherMonths
option.desc: Whether days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if the showOtherMonths option is set to true.

option.name: shortYearCutoff
option.desc: The cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] 'y'). Any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to the cutoff year are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century.

type.name: Number
type.desc: A value between 0 and 99 indicating the cutoff year.

type.name: String
type.desc: A relative number of years from the current year, e.g., "+3" or "-5".

option.name: showAnim
option.desc: The name of the animation used to show and hide the datepicker. Use "show" (the default), "slideDown", "fadeIn", any of the jQuery UI effects. Set to an empty string to disable animation.

option.name: showButtonPanel
option.desc: Whether to show the button panel.

option.name: showCurrentAtPos
option.desc: When displaying multiple months via the numberOfMonths option, the showCurrentAtPos option defines which position to display the current month in.

option.name: showMonthAfterYear
option.desc: Whether to show the month after the year in the header.

option.name: showOn
option.desc: When the datepicker should appear. The datepicker can appear when the field receives focus ("focus"), when a button is clicked ("button"), or when either event occurs ("both").

option.name: showOptions
option.desc: If using one of the jQuery UI effects for the showAnim option, you can provide additional settings for that animation via this option.

option.name: showOtherMonths
option.desc: Whether to display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use the selectOtherMonths option.

option.name: showWeek
option.desc: When true, a column is added to show the week of the year. The calculateWeek option determines how the week of the year is calculated. You may also want to change the firstDay option.

option.name: stepMonths
option.desc: Set how many months to move when clicking the previous/next links.

option.name: weekHeader
option.desc: The text to display for the week of the year column heading. Use the showWeek option to display this column.

option.name: yearRange
option.desc: The range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year ("-nn:+nn"), relative to the currently selected year ("c-nn:c+nn"), absolute ("nnnn:nnnn"), or combinations of these formats ("nnnn:-nn"). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the minDate and/or maxDate options.

option.name: yearSuffix
option.desc: Additional text to display after the year in the month headers.

option.name: beforeShow
option.desc: A function that takes an input field and current datepicker instance and returns an options object to update the datepicker with. It is called just before the datepicker is displayed.

option.name: beforeShowDay
option.desc: A function takes a date as a parameter and must return an array with [0] equal to true/false indicating whether or not this date is selectable, [1] equal to a CSS class name or "" for the default presentation, and [2] an optional popup tooltip for this date. It is called for each day in the datepicker before it is displayed.

option.name: onChangeMonthYear
option.desc: Called when the datepicker moves to a new month and/or year. The function receives the selected year, month (1-12), and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

option.name: onClose
option.desc: Called when the datepicker is closed, whether or not a date is selected. The function receives the selected date as text ("" if none) and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

option.name: onSelect
option.desc: Called when the datepicker is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

event.name: beforeShow
event.desc: Can be a function that takes an input field and current datepicker instance and returns an options object to update the datepicker with. It is called just before the datepicker is displayed.

event.name: beforeShowDay
event.desc: The function takes a date as a parameter and must return an array with [0] equal to true/false indicating whether or not this date is selectable, [1] equal to a CSS class name(s) or "" for the default presentation, and [2] an optional popup tooltip for this date. It is called for each day in the datepicker before it is displayed.

event.name: onChangeMonthYear
event.desc: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker moves to a new month and/or year. The function receives the selected year, month (1-12), and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

event.name: onClose
event.desc: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is closed, whether or not a date is selected. The function receives the selected date as text ("" if none) and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

event.name: onSelect
event.desc: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

method.name: dialog
method.desc: Opens the datepicker in a dialog box.

argument.name: onSelect
argument.desc: A callback function when a date is selected. The function receives the date text and date picker instance as parameters.

argument.name: settings
argument.desc: The new settings for the date picker.

argument.name: pos
argument.desc: The position of the top/left of the dialog as [x, y] or a MouseEvent that contains the coordinates. If not specified the dialog is centered on the screen.

method.name: isDisabled
method.desc: Determine whether a date picker has been disabled.

method.name: hide
method.desc: Close a previously opened date picker.

method.name: show
method.desc: Open the date picker. If the datepicker is attached to an input, the input must be visible for the datepicker to be shown.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Redraw the date picker, after having made some external modifications.

method.name: getDate
method.desc: Returns the current date for the datepicker or null if no date has been selected.

method.name: setDate
method.desc: Sets the date for the datepicker. The new date may be a Date object or a string in the current date format (e.g., "01/26/2009"), a number of days from today (e.g., +7) or a string of values and periods ("y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, "d" for days, e.g., "+1m +7d"), or null to clear the selected date.
